verses.text: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? \add why\add* hidest thou \add thyself\add* in times of trouble?
The wicked in \add his\add* pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, \add whom\add* the LORD abhorreth.
The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek \add after God\add* : God \add is\add* not in all his thoughts.
His ways are always grievous; thy judgments \add are\add* far above out of his sight: \add as for\add* all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for \add I shall\add* never \add be\add* in adversity.
His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue \add is\add* mischief and vanity.
He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
He croucheth, \add and\add* humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see \add it\add* .
Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thy hand: forget not the humble.
Why doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require \add it\add* .
Thou hast seen \add it\add* ; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite \add it\add* with thy hand: the poor committeth himself to thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil \add man\add* : seek out his wickedness \add till\add* thou shalt find none.
The LORD \add is\add* King for ever and ever: the heathen have perished out of his land.
LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thy ear to hear:
To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
